comment.author: 30817808@N00
comment._content: Great vintage boxing photo and Irish ,Cherokee-American too.

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: Shorpy says this photo was taken on November 24, 1913, when Morris was training for his eighth fight of the year, against Jess Willard, on December 3. The last three of those fights, including the Willard bout, were at Madison Square Garden, in New York City. According to the stats online, Morris lost to Willard "NWS" -- but I don't know what NWS means. He lost a bout with Gunboat Smith on October 9 "DQ" -- I don't know what that means either, but I doubt it stands for Dairy Queen. On September 19, Morris conquered Al Reich with a knockout in the first round.

comment._content:

comment.author: 17726131@N03
comment._content: It's interesting to see the level of fitness between a modern boxer and one from almost a hundred years ago.

comment.author: 21686909@N07
comment._content: Wystan, I think NWS is short for Newspaper.  When there was a close match, a draw, sometimes the local or reporting newspaper would make the decision who won.

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content:
Another Bain/LOC photo of Morris in this room, 11/24/13:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/4605956627/in/photostream/]

comment.author: 8560391@N03
comment._content: Budderflyman and Mikescottnz, you're correct; NWS = newspaper decision and DQ = disqualification. Newspaper decisions were not official, but definitely are reliable. By the way, Here's Carl's record at boxrec.com.
